metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1802 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If an attacker was able to corrupt the methods of an Array object in JavaScript via prototype pollution, they could have achieved execution of attacker-controlled JavaScript code in a privileged context. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 91.9.1, Firefox < 100.0.2, Firefox for Android < 100.3.0, and Thunderbird < 91.9.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1802` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
